text:
Hello Team HubSpot ,
I am here in hope that yo will contact me soon and resolve my issue
My issue is that the standard Stripe integration does not help me a lot, so I want to make a custom API call out for the Stripe but the issue I am facing are

- On workflow webhook we can't able to achieve the access codes because we cannot edit the header content-type on the webhook element , so please help me to get sample for access code and contact from Stripe curl.

_ On other hand if I am going with the Python or nodejs then we have to import stripe package but where should I make it install in HubSpot system , as I created manually but it does not helped.

Basically I want to make callout for Customer and payment of Stripe so that I can add some custom functionality on it.

Please help me with the solution soon , or share any related thing to this .

Thanks & Regards
Prateek Choudhary
There the code from one of my blog posts. Obviously you'd have to tweak it for you own use and style it
there is the CSS for it
is it possible to read the HubSpot tracking cookie "original source" property on the server (ie. PHP) running on a domain that is added to HubSpot

I think webhook isn't the solution here.

At this moment HubSpot hasn't added support for stripe package yet. I agree, it would be good idea :+1:  you can't install it by yourself. Meanwhile you can make request directly to api endpoints:
```import requests
payload = {'amount': 2000, 'currency': 'eur', 'customer': 'XXXX', 'capture': true}
r = <http://requests.post|requests.post>("<https://api.stripe.com/v1/charges>", data=payload, auth=('[SECRET]', ''))
print(r.status_code, r.text)```
Replace the token with your own. And add them as <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/workflows/custom-code-actions#secrets|secrets> in workflow.

Supported libraries in Custom coded action in workflow are listed here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/workflows/custom-code-actions>
BLOG OPTIMIZATION IN HubSpot: Any suggestions on why?

How to add new(custom) task priority ?

Hi, trying to embed a HubSpot form using Elementor. Get the following errors without the form loading (the iframe is in place though):

VM54 v2.js:1 Couldn't find target container #hbspt-form-999d53a5-ed5a-4533-9451-210d9b75f752 for HubSpot Form 87e508ee-1173-4a91-aafc-da4128535e7d. Not rendering form onto the page
i @ VM54 v2.js:1
v2.js:1 [] Unsupported context key: referrer
Guys, it is possible to backup all data from my HubSpot account?
Good day, I'm trying to use the HubSpot API via the Python SDK to get a list of meetings associated with a company, and I'm unable to retrieve that data
I tried asking for help via the community forum: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Accessing-meetings-for-company/m-p/720134>
no responses there after almost two months
So I'm here trying trying the Slack Channel
Here's a snippet of the code I'm trying: <https://dpaste.org/A5Hkv> it returns a response, but the response is filled with "nulls"
The data returned looks like `{'id': None, 'type': None}` there's no hint in the API response as to why this is happening

This code should work:

```import HubSpot
from pprint import pprint
from HubSpot.crm.companies import ApiException

client = HubSpot.Client.create(access_token="YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN")

try:
    api_response = client.crm.companies.associations_api.get_all(company_id=100, to_object_type="0-47", limit=500)
    pprint(api_response)
except ApiException as e:
    print("Exception when calling associations_api->get_all: %s\n" % e)```
Don't have time to test but I don't see any problems with it

<@U01QVR44MEY> thanks... i think it does now, seems like there was a bug in the Associations API that was fixed _after_ I started working on this.

<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-python/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md>
I haven't had time to update the ticket, just testing out with the new SDK version
but I'm at least getting actual data now
<@U01QVR44MEY> thanks for the follow up though
Yeah, personally I would suggest staying away from the SDK and using the endpoints because they are much more predicable
Okay, noted
The Node and Python SDK always seem to have weird behavior

<@U01QVR44MEY> well this was definitely the case...  I just happened to check for an update on the SDK after posting in the <#C22PU4LV8|general> and noticed i was behind... upgrade, and the same code started returning data
That's really unfortunate sorry that happened
Just glad to get this solved... my co-workers will be happy
thank you for your time... sorry I hadn't updated with fix
You're totally good man, reach out if you have any other issues
Will do
Looks like the Python SDK was simply broken, and fixed an issue with the Association API in a later version: <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-python/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md>
